intro: Galium vogesiacum, commonly known as the Voges bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium vogesiacum is often found in the understorey of temperate forests, where it plays a role in maintaining ecological balance.
